name: Bee Cottage Guest House

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at Bee Cottage on our way across country on the C2C cycle route. This place really is in the middle of nowhere and we had a great cycle ride to it along the Waskerly Way. Surrounded by moorland and rolling countryside where sheep graze, you feel like you really are getting away from it all.
reviews.title: Very warm welcome and great home cooked food

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were greeted with a friendly welcome from Irene and David, who made us a cup of tea on arrival, which we had whilst chatting to them both before we were shown to our room.
reviews.title: In all ways an outstanding place to stay.

reviews.text: The room was clean and cosy with the usual TV, tea and coffee facilities and there was an en-suite shower room with toiletries for use.
reviews.title: Superb stay, ultra-friendly, and B&B chic!

reviews.text: As it was in the middle of nowhere, David cooked us our evening meal. As we waited to be served, Irene chatted to us and we had wonderful views of the Northumbrian landscape from the conservatory window. David then served the food. This was the best food we ate on the C2C – proper, good, healthy home cooked food – exactly what you want after cycling all day. You have to pre-book the food and we had a parsnip and apple soup, vegetarian shepherd’s pie with fresh veg followed by plum and apple crumble and custard. It was filling and delicious! The place is licensed so we were able to buy a bottle of wine. We then retired to the guest TV room. There is also a guest quiet room where you can spend time reading from the vast array of books that are available.
reviews.title: Beautiful Setting

reviews.text: Breakfast was served once again in the conservatory and again it was the best breakfast we had across the whole C2C. Care was taken that we had a vegetarian breakfast, with veggie sausages – usually we have to make do with a cooked breakfast minus the meat, despite informing guest houses before arrival that we are vegetarian.
reviews.title: real country B&B

likes.liked: — the views over the countryside and the garden

reviews.text: Bee Cottage is a lovely countryside cottage on walking/ biking trails. Surrounded by stone walled fields and sheep. Fabulous garden. The present owners have been gradually renovating the place. Its much larger than I thought. Some of the interior is still dated but I don't think this matters too much. The bedroom we stayed in was a double ensuite shower with tea coffee all the bits. Not huge rooms but fine. You can choose a private appartment which has more space. I think this would be sensible if you were staying for a few days. For general guests there is a pleasant lounge and lots of books, maps andbrochures on what to do. Bee Cottage is licensed and provide meals which is geat. The owners can provide information on luggage delivery for walkers or cyclists, bike hire, provide packed lunches... just about everything. We turned up after an evening flight into Newcastle and after a dark and foggy drive it was nice to be greeted with fruitcake and be able to buy a bottle of wine. Owners are charming and knowledgeable. I had to drive into Durham the next day for a conference approx. 30 mins. Breakfast choice is good in a nice area looking out over the garden and fields.
reviews.title: Very pleasant country B&B

likes.liked: — Quality meals provided & reasonably priced wine. Nice lounge area.

reviews.title: Nice one
reviews.text: Thumbs up. Friendly staff, comfy room and a beautiful setting. But what really makes Bee Cottage stand out is the tasty homemade food.

reviews.title: brill b&b
reviews.text: We have just spent 2 nights at Bee Cottage Farm, Castleside Co durham owners Malita and David superb hosts. food "all home-made" excellent value. The views magnificent, just off the A68. a definite recommend

reviews.title: Lovely Stay at Bee Cottage
reviews.text: My wife and I enjoyed a two night stay in Bee Farm Cottage, near Consett in County Durham.
